07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:02): DrBacchus: I met him this summer at a conference. Nice guy, but I think he is in over his head... but.. time will tell.
4651a4fbb52af3c944288c36ad7c873b (02:02): meh. then again, i got out of webdesign, php, etc a couple years ago
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:02): I started contributing patches with inline documentation for the Wordpress docs. He rejected them beacuse he feels that documentation == code bloat.

45f727f0312e90f82c6c337000c476a9 (02:13): [Mon Sep 04 14:07:43 2006] [error] [client 24.56.41.111] client denied by server                                                                              configuration: /www/img/
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:13): See? Nothing to do with file permissions.
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:13): So a file mode of 777 did nothing for you.

006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:13): I can have apache2 bind to a IPv6 socket by using 'Listen 80', but it doesn't work with a single v6 address or having it bind to all IPv6 but not v4 (Listen [::]:80). Does anyone know how to do that?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:13): server configuration
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:13): server configuration is not file permissions
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (02:13): fedt: don't go and do things blindly
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:14): Right, but even if it was, 777 isn't the right solution.
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:14): client denied by server                                                                              configuration
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:14): Darn it
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:14): fajita: client denied by server configuration

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:14): DrBacchus: Access was denied by a deny directive or if you changed the DocumentRoot, also change a <Directory > Block from the old root, to the new one. or you need a <Directory> or <Location> block for every Alias
006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:14): I tried it with apaches that were compiled with --enable-v4-mapping as well as --disable-v4-mapping
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:14): JochenA: so, you want IPv6 only?
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:14): Oh, sorry, I got it backwards.
006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:15): I want to bind to two IPv4 addresses and one IPv6 out of all the available addresses.
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (02:15): fedt: What fajita said.
006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:15): and for testing I want the v4 ones on a different port, the v6 on port 80
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:15): JochenA: a specific address, or any address available on the machine?
006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:16): chipig: One specific address
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:16): easy
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:16): easy is a little ambiguous
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:16): Listen [fe80::20e:2eff:fe04:f3ca]:80
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:16): replace the crap inside the [] with your address
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (02:16): IPv6 is so clean. heh
006bad23cccac44839fbe61d5c61582d (02:17): chipig: That will give me an error (Address already in use: make_sock: could not bind to address...)
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:17): JochenA: what other listen statements do you have?
07a22eeffc1cb40df2054130edd6334a (02:17): JochenA: and is this linux or bsd?
